title: Upvote for a "Gold Given to Enemy Team" stat at end of game.
body:
> The postgame should have a "Gold given to enemy team" stat so people realize this.
-Little Mac is OP


This must happen. It will show how important not dying is.

replies.body: You could make it less passive-aggressive by making it an 'Overall gold balance' stat that takes gold gained from kills/assists and subtracts gold given up to enemy kills/assists.

Honestly, if people are offended by "Gold Given to Enemy Team"..... 

That's just way too much oversensitivity

It would honestly probably just breed more toxicity with people using it as another stat to harass people with.

Kinda like people go into champ select look at other players profiles and then immediately flame them.

While you're right, people who want to flame someone will always find a reason to. Just because it's easier to find it changes nothing.
Also they can just make it visible only to the player themselves.

>Also they can just make it visible only to the player themselves.

Yes I wanna know it for me too. And people get tilted if they get killed 4 times in a row.
This way they will learn that going 0-4-10 is better than 5-4-0. Point being they will understand the importance of working as a team. 

And after months of reading the stuff they maybe realize that "Who fed  3-3-1 Jinx" is pointless when she has double the farm from everybody else.

> [{quoted}](name=VulDread,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tWU5AcV8,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-03-06T07:23:36.594+0000)
>
> Honestly, if people are offended by "Gold Given to Enemy Team"..... 
> 
> That's just way too much oversensitivity

It's not about being "oversensitive". No one likes to be harassed in post game chat. We're not robots. You can't expect people to be perfect at this game. If someone screwed up just deal with it. I'm sure that person already feels really upset about it. No need to be a dick in post game chat.
I don't think it's offended but another "you suck" measure aside from deaths and overall low numbers.
And in some people's minds, high deaths is fine if you have high kills. This kind of system would show why it isn't.
Well high deaths can be fine if you have high kills.  I feel this angle enters an extremely subjective area.

No because high kills concentrates a high amount of gold onto you, while high deaths can spread it to many enemies.  ESPECIALLY if your getting lots of solo kills and your team isnt getting assists, while the enemies are gang beating you.  Throug hthis process its likely you will get shut down while the rest of your team struggles because the enemy team all got strong.
It's less about the person "giving" gold being sensitive and other players being rude about it. It's better if it the stat name itself doesn't say "You're a feeder."
Passive-aggressive? That is not passive-aggressive. That's a simple statistic. By your same logic the death counter is Mr. Tryndamere mocking all of us.
I upvoted this so hard
Except it isn't passive-aggressive at all......it is LITERALLY telling you how much of a feeder you are.

When my lane opponent kills me twice, buys items, and then kills me a third time I'm acutely aware of how much I'm helping them. 

Also, to be fair, we'd also have to track how many fat bounties that you let your team collect. That's my solo lane strategy:  Get some bounty gold going for my marksman. If he's good, he'll collect!

What about Amount of Damage Prevented for shield supports? could that be done? I feel like it would be a good way to get more satisfaction out of support, as well as a better way to better appreciate our supports.

Not only could that stat be for shields, but for any damage that teammates would have taken that is prevented by a player as well, like from Bond of Stone, Taric's W aura, Locket's MR aura, Braum's jump-thing, etc.

The effectiveness of AS reductions and slows/CC in general can't be calculated that neatly though, which is why supports' effectiveness will always be overlooked by people that don't play the role.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sotere,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tWU5AcV8,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2016-03-06T20:22:30.082+0000)
>
> When my lane opponent kills me twice, buys items, and then kills me a third time I'm acutely aware of how much I'm helping them. 
> 
> Also, to be fair, we'd also have to track how many fat bounties that you let your team collect. That's my solo lane strategy:  Get some bounty gold going for my marksman. If he's good, he'll collect!

We do, but the problem is when you have players that go, say, "12/12/0" and then complain how much their "0/5/10" teamate fed and can use their feeding self to end world hunger, you can show them that they fed more gold...

You can do the math yourself if you want to counter-asshole so bad.  Otherwise just mute, report, move on.  I don't think Riot should feel obligated to help players play the "who performed worse" game.

Maybe I worded it badly.

I don't want to use it to play the, "You did worse so shut your mouth," game. 0/5/10 is still a bad score in my eyes in most cases.

What I meant was having facts there to explain to them they also fed gold, and therefor they should also be trying to not die so much for it. I didn't mean an intent of harassing someone, but instead just being able to show in game statistics that going 12/12/0 is hurting the team a lot more.

Plus either way people will use anything to be toxic about it. I've seen players afk over fighting someone higher ranked in them. I've seen people intentionally feed because the new champ select didn't give them their primary. If someone is going to use the numbers to be toxic about it, it can be gladly reported with a note saying, "Read post champ select please." If the high amount of reports say it's in post chat, Riot will read it.

I fail to see how your understanding that you are feeding has anything at all to do with this topic. The fact is that you work for riot so if you didn't understand that it would be absurd. We are discussing putting this in for players who do NOT understand how much gold they are feeding the enemy team by trading kills. Your knowledge or lack thereof has NOTHING to do with this discussion and honestly pretty lame of you to bring that into it.

It's akin to going to a starving household and being like "I know you guys don't have any food, but I do, so I don't see a problem"
Do you honestly think that people are completely ignorant that when they die the enemy team gets gold?
They must be. otherwise i wouldn't see them do it over and over and over and over and over and over.

It's called forgetting they're already stronger than you, forgetting that to get that juicy farm to comeback someway you're overextending and putting yourself in danger, trying to make up for your feeding by trying to make team plays and screwing up, being behind on a lane bully and as a result getting poked down and being unable to allin, being unsafe under turret, etc.

You seem to be confused. Your response would suggest that i was searching for clarification as to WHY they feed. This is not the case, and infact has even less to do with what we are discussing than what Sotere had to "add" to the topic.

> [{quoted}](name=Tobias Brackner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tWU5AcV8,comment-id=001100010000,timestamp=2016-03-06T21:05:10.286+0000)
>
> Do you honestly think that people are completely ignorant that when they die the enemy team gets gold?

> [{quoted}](name=Ritomyburrito,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tWU5AcV8,comment-id=0011000100000000,timestamp=2016-03-06T21:06:02.158+0000)
>
> They must be. otherwise i wouldn't see them do it over and over and over and over and over and over.

They=people that die ingame.
Please look at what I replied to.
lmfao, you really are thick. You even went back and still aren't making any sense. I can tell there is no point in speaking to you as you will not understand what i am saying.

What?

You said that people must be ignorant of the fact that when they die the enemy team gets gold, and then he responded with reasons they might take risks and then die while behind, even while knowing of the gold they give the enemy team.

It would seem you don't understand what he's saying, here.

Why you gotta be so rude yo? I've been polite to you.

Additionally, your point doesn't make sense. It makes sense if you had never typed this:

> [{quoted}](name=Ritomyburrito,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tWU5AcV8,comment-id=0011000100000000,timestamp=2016-03-06T21:06:02.158+0000)
>
> **They must be**. otherwise i wouldn't see them do it over and over and over and over and over and over.

[emphasis mine]

However, this means that you're saying they HAVE to be unaware of the gold they give the enemy. And then the next poster posits some reasons that people could be aware of the gold they're giving the enemy team and still end up feeding badly.

So, unless you have some reasoning, logic, or proof that shows why people are ALWAYS unaware of this fact when feeding badly, you would seem to be in the wrong here.

It is scary that you are this stupid. I typed that in RESPONSE to a DIFFERENT POST. Holy crap you can't really but that stupid can you? my lord. Learn how english works and moreover how to follow a conversation. fuck me.

Why you gotta be so rude yo? I've been polite to you.

I don't see how the post you typed it in response to matters. We're discussing the point that originated within that post. Unless some specific aspect of the context is missing that has large impact on the meaning, in which case if you would enlighten us...

Why you gotta be like this?

I'm just trying to have a discussion with you, and you're being so angry about everything, to the point of being somewhat difficult to discuss with.

You do that, it's tracked as "gold".

 Also, YOU understand this. The issue is the millions upon millions of players who don't.
Do you honestly believe that there are millions and millions of players who do not know that when they are killed, the enemy team gets gold?

How many times did you not c&p this highly c&pable message?

 Anyway, no, most players get that the enemy gets money when they die.

 What they DON'T understand is that diving into a 1v3 for a kill followed by a swift death is a net positive for the enemy team, and doing this repeatedly during a game will have a negative impact on their Gold Given score (and also make them the team's anchor). And they don't understand why this is bad because they KEEP DOING IT.

 In nearly every conceivable case 0/0 is a better score than 5/5 and people just do not understand why. If stats are not intended to measure performance, why do we have any stats at all?

"net positive for the enemy team"  If they get the kill then it's even.  If a person is constantly doing this and not getting kills or is otherwise screwing over the team, then explain it to them.  

"In nearly every conceivable case 0/0 is a better score than 5/5"  Ok so I feel we are gonna enter some subjective shit, cuz from where I'm sitting (not including bounties) both of those are the exact same thing gold-wise.  "In nearly every conceivable case" Homie, those cases are almost infinite, all that tells you is a rough estimate of gold gained and gold given to enemy team.  The fact that those numbers can't reflect bounties alone should tell you how unreliable using k/d is as evidence w/o other factors.

"If stats are not intended to measure performance, why do we have any stats at all?"  WHERE THE FLYING FUCK DID YOU PULL THIS FROM?  Like, holy shit your argument is this labyrinth of assumptions and other bullshit and now you pull this shit out of your ass?  Is this meant to imply that stats don't measure performance already?  Wtf????
this is totally not related to the other thread titled _Please realize 3/1/10 is way better than 20/19/2_ which is totally not related to the other thread titled _8/7/0 is not better than 0/7/20_
seems legit
And a "allied damage shielded" stat as well. Id like to know just how much damage my lulu prevented
I would love to have this stat, not just for Lulu, but almost anyone with a shield.
Yeah like braum, Leona , and pantheon!....
I dunno, people could just use it as a way of flaming someone who did poorly.

That's a stat that can't really be measured. You could only measure the gold given to enemies by dieing.
But not applying any pressure in lane and thus granting free farm also is giving free gold to my opponent, same for surrendering towers, not helping an ally or giving up onjectives for free because of to passive play.

Such a stat would mostly be blameing a scapegoat as it doesn't consider any of the circumstances or indirect gold given, and it would moste likely create toxicity at the end of game screen where the loosing team stats tp pick on the guy with most gold given to enemy team.

If i play jungle and get killed by the opposing jungler+support invadeing while neither bot nor mid of my team offer any help and bot didn't even ward river, then statistically it would be gold i lost though the main fault lies at bot as they allowed the support of them to roam while not providing needed vision at the same time, while also not reacting to the invade.

I i just wait under my tower midlane till the minions get where, i am save and mostlikely don't give a kill, but i allow my opponent not only to freefarm but also to roam, and if the enemy midlaner and jungler now go bot for a 4 vs 2 dive, it's more my fault than theirs, especially if i didn't even warn them.
Sure there is, it's just on the advanced details page.
So what prevents a toxic player from harassing you because you fed the enemy more gold than them?

What prevents a toxic player from harassing you at all?
Do they really need excuses?
